title: ICT-integrated Language Education Design for Students with Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Knowledge of Special Education and Universal Design for Learning (UDL) Principles
context.additional_context: Strengthening competencies in utilizing ICT tools to support inclusive learning for students with disabilities in language education.

learning_goals: Learners can design three types of smartphone-based language learning activities by applying UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles.
Learners can propose implementation strategies for at least five ICT tools suitable for different disability types (visual, auditory, physical).
Learners can develop project deliverables executable in a constrained technological environment (smartphone-centric).

resources: Smart Device-Compatible Assistive Technology App (Text-to-Speech, Zoom, etc.)
Learning Case Database for Students with Disabilities
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
